item.title: Tips for debug C++ code in emacs
item.dc:creator: Chen Bin
item.description:
• M-x gdb then M-x gdb-many-windows
  • display/call/s(tep)/n(ext)/watch in gud-mode
  • assert, use frame #num to located the failed assertion
  • windmove-down/up/left/right to move between many windows
  • winnner-mode to redo/undo windows layout
  • C-x r w to save widnows layout, C-x r j to load windows layout

item.title: Emacs gdb/gud hotkeys
item.dc:creator: Chen Bin
item.description:
Please note if you're using Emacs 24 on OS X 10.7.3, you need `M-x gud-gdb` instead `M-x gdb` to start debug session.

It's because `M-x gdb` assume gdb 7.x installed while there is actually only gdb 6.3 installed.

  • C-x C-a C-d gud-remove
  • C-x C-a C-b gud-break
  • C-x C-a C-g gud-run (customized by me)
  • C-x C-a C-p gud-print
  • C-x C-a C-r gud-continue
